lexUnit.name: breathe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take air into the lungs and then expel it as a regular physiological process.

sentence.text: I did n't want him to breathe that stuff into his lungs , " he says .
I ca n't breathe ! ”
I ca n't breathe properly .
Do you know that fish ca n't breathe unless they 're in water ?
` The men can hardly breathe . "
Her assailants had covered her face and pinched her nose so that she could not breathe .
Robbie could hardly breathe and she had to swallow before she could answer .
And some life might be breathed into Labour 's democracy of the dead at last .
She stood on the embankment breathing in gulps of air as he stood awkwardly by her , then fumbled for a handkerchief and he saw that she was crying .
Your brain needs oxygen and that means you should breathe plenty of fresh air .
Delgard breathed in the frosty air and expelled a white mist as if it were an escaping soul .
Going out on to Des Voeux , she breathed in the hot , humid air .
The sun was up , the dark clouds disappeared and for a moment she breathed easy .
He fell onto his pallet , breathing hard .
He mounted the slope with effort , breathing hard .
Breathe in through the nose and out hard through the mouth , both to a slow count of four .
In the blue light of the morning he breathed his last .
She breathed the last gasp of smoke towards the ceiling and stubbed out her cigarette .
Cloistered in converted farm buildings a few miles from York … craftsmen breathe new life into Fairford 's medieval glass .
It is after all a dealers ' fair and gives us a chance to show what we have to potential and established clients without the auction houses breathing down our necks .
Endill 's whole body breathed a sigh of relief as the Headmaster gave him the letter .
Adam breathed a sigh of relief .
He was in coma , and as he breathed he made a terrible bubbling sound .
So long as they were n't too close and breathing their germs on her , Gloria liked there to be people about .
Oxygen booths , in which people will be able to breathe pure oxygen at the cost of $2 a minute , are to be installed around Mexico City centre .
Jesus had breathed his Spirit upon his disciples .
He was breathing in short fast gasps .
The major hazards will come from aerosols containing microbes that are breathed in by workers in biotechnology factories .
He swayed a little as he breathed fumes of wine into her face .
And he sure is breathing bad .
She was breathing deeply , her breasts heaving , fighting to get a grip on herself .
He breathed deeply before speaking again .
She closed her eyes and breathed deeply , pretending to be asleep .
• Check that your child 's heart is beating and he is breathing regularly and , if necessary , give artificial respiration ( see Not Breathing ) .
The doctor presses on Andy 's chest while his wife breathes into the boy 's mouth .
Place your lips around the child 's mouth and breathe into his lungs
Victor breathed on the glass in his hand , and buffed it until it gleamed .
He breathed lovingly on the silver and polished it with his sleeve .
He stood straight and breathed through his mouth tasting mint coolness .
The stag breathed heavily through its nose .
I tried breathing through the sleeves of my tracksuit .
George breathed in his ear .
The idea is that they 'll breathe in the gene from an inhaler and it will attach to the walls of cells in the lungs .
She breathed in his familiar odour of best bitter and Woodbines and snuggled against him , safe and secure .
There they breathe in pure oxygen at high pressure .
Jenna lay looking at the sky , breathing in the smell of the grass and smiling to herself .
They had come quietly but Tom had ears that could hear a mouse moving underground , or a squirrel breathing in a tree .
Most modern fish breathe in water with gills , but many species living in foul , swampy water supplement this by gulping air at the surface .
In spite of his initial impression , he was breathing without difficulty .
She breathed out two long straight bars of smoke , which gradually broke up and dispersed .
But he was breathing , and he was not having an arterial haemorrhage .
Cranston breathed , and stared pityingly at the white-hooded faces .
He raised his visor and breathed cautiously .
Ruth breathed feverishly and Steve looked at her curiously .
He was breathing heavily .
